key_points: Increasing disputes related to constitutional and legal interpretation
Recurring challenges on similar legal provisions across multiple years
Hotspot states showing repeated institutional trust issues
naratif: Rising and recurring disputes involving constitutional and legal provisions indicate emerging structural gaps in implementation, uneven awareness of legal rights and possible erosion of institutional trust in certain regions.

key_points: Weak internal control mechanisms in some enforcement agencies
Pressure to meet operational targets without sufficient safeguards
Limited whistleblower protection discouraging internal reporting
naratif: Integrity issues within enforcement agencies are often driven by weak internal controls, performance pressures that override due process and an environment where whistleblowers feel insufficiently protected.

key_points: Higher exposure to cross-border crime and irregular migration
Potential spillover of regional conflicts into border areas
Increased burden on frontline enforcement and logistics
naratif: Border security weaknesses heighten exposure to cross-border crime, irregular migration and regional conflict spillover, increasing operational pressure on frontline agencies and elevating long-term security risks.

key_points: Overlapping mandates between agencies in social and economic security
Gaps in data sharing and joint risk assessment
Slow escalation processes for emerging socio-political tensions
naratif: Fragmented regulatory and process arrangements across social, economic and political domains delay early detection of systemic risks and create blind spots where tensions escalate without timely, coordinated intervention.

key_points: Ageing critical infrastructure and legacy systems
Underinvestment in security hardening and upgrades
Dependence on a small pool of specialised personnel
naratif: National security assets are increasingly exposed due to ageing infrastructure, underinvestment in security upgrades and heavy dependence on a limited pool of specialised staff, all of which drive systemic vulnerability.
